title: What animal do these bones come from? - Quora

response.answer_text: the pair are cannon bones of some herbivore - could be sheep, could be deer could be cow etc. need a scale to get any idea of which. The long bone on edge is probably a toe from something or other. A different view would help. The near spherical thing is the head of a femur, again could be just about anything. If you get something positively identified that might well help with other things.

There are very few bones to go by. Those are not digits in the ends there but where the bones formed a joint. Judging by the size--and depending on what kinds of animals you have around you--I'd hazard a guess that it's a deer. But that would just be a guess. It could be a large dog.
